text: Team, I need help in the updating the blog feature image on frontend. I have uploaded the image on backend but not reflecting the changes on front end.

Hi Everyone,

I’m looking for an idea to style a HubSpot form.

One of the fields is a list of more than 50 checkboxes, and the user has to scroll a long way to see the submit button.
I want to find a way that when a field has more than 10 checkboxes, it becomes a two-column list.

Solutions I found so far but can’t implement due to some restrictions:
• Create two different fields in HubSpot, and target them by the generated class name
• On form load, query the DOM and add a custom class if there are more than 10 list items.
Are there any CSS gurus that can solve it with CSS only, without using JavaScript? Or any other approaches that I didn’t think of.
I’m initiating the forms on custom modules with the `{% form ...`  syntax.
There is a post on the forums about this. Please upvote: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Allow-loading-new-CTAs-Beta-outside-of-iframe/idi-p/811227>
